messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:40): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3: actually no, the common case is that the interfaces are only visible to global objects that implement WindowBrowsingContext
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:41): pretty much nothing (only ECMA262-defined types) are visible to the "empty" global object, for instance
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (08:41): where's this empty one defined?  i tried searching for "null global object" but didn't get anywhere.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:43): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/browsers.html#script0
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:44): and http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/browsers.html#the-javascript paragraph 3
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (08:45): so "script browsing context" means the global script object?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:46): there's an open bug on figuring out what it means exactly
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:46): global objects are very complex
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:46): since the global object has to change when you navigate, but there's only one Window object per window
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:47): so you get pschyzophrenic code

a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (08:50): so is it possible for script to be running, the page navigates to something else, but that same script is running, and its global object is now a different object?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:51): the global object is the same, but the 'window' attribute on that global object no longer points to the global object, even though the value it used to have is === the value that it had when it _was_ equal to the global object
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (08:52): ah, interesting
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (08:52): i never realised they could be different
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:52): the web is a crazy crazy platform
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:53): basically the Window object reflects the properties of the global object of the active document
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:53): and you can never get a pointer to the actual global object
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:53): as i understand it
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (08:54): so you don't consider the Window object to be the actual global object?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:56): well right now none of this is defined
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:56): but yeah
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (08:57): that's kind of strange
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (08:57): i mean, always though the Window object was exactly the same object that 'this' refers to at the top level of your script
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (08:57): s/always though/i &t/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:58): it is
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:58): the 'this' is not the actual global object, it turns out
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:58): but an object pretending to be it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:58): as i understand it
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (08:59): then i resign
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:59): see also http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=5850
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (08:59): q.v. topic :-)

a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (09:03): so html5 will says something like:  "when you go to run a script, instead of evaluating it with the ecma-262 global object as the 'this' value, evaluate it with this strange Window object that mostly reflects the ecma-262 global object as the 'this' value"?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:04): dunno, haven't figured it out yet
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (09:06): let me know when you do :)
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (09:06): (well, i'll see the mails from the bug anyway)

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:08): thanks
